Material used.Description: Fibroblasts were isolated from explanted patient’s biopsy specimen.

Readout description.Result Description: Patient’s fibroblasts showed a significant 30% inhibition of the KCN sensitive endogenous respiration but no detectable change in the specific activity of any of the single mitochondrial respiratory chain complexes.
The m.12397A>G missense mutation changes a threonine in alanine at position 21 of the ND5 subunit.
The m.14319T>C mutation changes an asparagine in aspartic acid at position 119 of the ND6 subunit.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was conducted on multiple batches of fibroblasts.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal human dermal fibroblasts (NHDF) were used as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two tailed Student’s t test was applied, with a p<0.05.

Material used.Description: Ultrasound treated fibroblasts were suspended in potassium phosphate buffer.

Readout description.Result Description: Patient’s fibroblasts showed a significant 30% inhibition of the KCN sensitive endogenous respiration but no detectable change in the specific activity of any of the single mitochondrial respiratory chain complexes.
The m.12397A>G missense mutation changes a threonine in alanine at position 21 of the ND5 subunit.
The m.14319T>C mutation changes an asparagine in aspartic acid at position 119 of the ND6 subunit.

Material used.Description: Cells were cultured at low density on fibronectin coated 35 mm glass bottom dishes.

Readout description.Result Description: Patient’s fibroblasts displayed a constitutive significant twofold increase of the probe related fluorescence when compared with NHDFs.
The m.12397A>G missense mutation changes a threonine in alanine at position 21 of the ND5 subunit.
The m.14319T>C mutation changes an asparagine in aspartic acid at position 119 of the ND6 subunit.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was conducted on multiple batches of fibroblasts.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal human dermal fibroblasts (NHDF) were used as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two tailed Student’s t test was applied, with a p<0.05.
